TEXT.P: Oil is central to the functioning of today's global economy. Yet oil is a nonrenewable resource. The world's store of oil will eventually be depleted, forcing a shift to a global economy based on a different energy source. Just how close are we to depleting the world's available oil?
The table at left shows the rate of oil production since 1950 in millions of barrels per day. We can use this as a starting point for estimating how much oil remains.
